name: Coppid Beech Hotel

reviews.text: After reading previous reviews, i was wondering if i stayed in the same Hotel as others!
reviews.title: Very impressed!!!!
Needs renovations
reviews.text: I was there for one night after attending a local cat show, i was allowed to take my cat to the Hotel with me for a small charge.
Check in was a breeze, attended to by a very polite girl on the desk.
reviews.title: No more than 3 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only slight hitch was that they need the actual credit card you booked with to take a copy. (we normally fax through the details & that is sufficient) Not to worry, i used my own card & i was on my way.
reviews.title: Horrible! Don't waste your time in this dump!

reviews.text: Someone appeared by magic to ask if i wanted help with my bags, so that was great.
reviews.title: A good time had by all!!!!

reviews.text: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Coppid Beech booked through Legoland themselves and found the week to be excellent value for money. I made the mistake of looking at other reviews the night before we were due to leave and panicked all night that I had booked the wrong place. However, we arrived and the hotel looked good on first impressions and then we got to our room waiting for the disaster ... but there wasn't one - a lovely room suitable for us and our 3 small children also equipped with a jacuzzi bath which the kids thought was great. Breakfast was fabulous but other meals seemed overpriced so we ate out - beefeater, harvester, pizza hut, the plough and room service one night. The only down side was the pool which we only tried once and said never agin it was filthy with tiles around the pool mouldy a used plaster by the pool and general wear and tear just out of control. Would definitely recommend as a base for Legoland.
reviews.title: What a lovely week!

reviews.text: Stayed on legoland Package end of June (2 adults 3kids.) Given suite with extra fold up beds for kids aged 11,8 ,and 5. in seperate alcove . Room was very spacious ,clean and comfortable. Mightn't suit if kids wer any older but it was sufficient for us . Found all staff to be friendly. Good selection of food for breakfast . Thought food in Keller bar was overpriced for what you got- also a bit slow. Have adopted a no smoking policy in the bar which was good. Overall enjoyed our stay and would return.
reviews.title: Legoland package
Not as good as before
reviews.text: Sorry, but having stayed here several times before this could be the last time,prices over the top at the bar.Meals in house very expensive for the quality, had to wait 38mins for roast of the day! The stuffy chap on reception needs customer sevices training. However the staff in the resturant very plesanat and helpfull and a credit to the place.

reviews.title: Extremely satisfied
reviews.text: Dont know why its gone down hill but it has.

reviews.title: average hotel ok for base
reviews.text: Although this hotel hasn't recently been decorated as mentioned in some reviews it was very pleasant our room was lovely, very spacious with plenty of room for us and our two children. The staff couldn't have been nicer & I can't believe that any of the staff could be said to be arrogant, every single member of staff that we came into contact with was pleasant very helpful and all made the effort to make a fuss of the children they went out of their way to accomadate us. The lobby area with a bar is suitable to sit with the children and the children are also welcome in the excellent restaurant which serves a childrens menu. We would definately stay here again.

stayed in a family room on a legoland package and i have to say having read the other reviews i could not see what they were complaining about-- the hotel is spacious and clean and elegant as soon as yopu enter-- all the staff we encountered were most help[ful very polite and well groomed- the family room was superb---- 3 separate beds in one section with a walk through arch into the main double room--- furniture was first class with dining table for 4 elegant sofas and chairs in the room--- en suite was clean and everything worked---- some small details could be enhanced such as grout missing from in between tiles but this is as small as it got---- we used the pool, twice a day the kids loved it along with the steam room and jacuzzi--
reviews.title: bad reviews not desreved
Please stay away from the Coppid
reviews.text: breakfast was buffett style and was excellent quality waiting staff attentive and prompt---meals a bit on the pricey side so we went out for evening meals--
if corporate visitors are used to sumptuous 5 star elegance then they may be disappointed but for families and down to earth people this hotel i would gladly suggest to others
reviews.title: Coppid Beach NOT recommended.

reviews.text: The phone lines were not working. No hot water. The elevators dont work. Terrible......and the answer from the reception was ......sorry sir we are having a bad week!!!! Amazing. Stay out !!!!
reviews.title: Now quite as good as a Motel 6
great hotel
reviews.text: Room is tiny for what you pay and staff are rude, arrogant & unhelpful. Avoid.
I stayed at the Coppid Beech, for one night only on a business trip. I was looking forward to staying there as the room was rather pricey and I was told that it was a nice place.
reviews.title: Needs a refurbishment ASAP

likes.liked: — The Swiss Chalet sytle of the hotel is orignial I guess (well in Bracknell at least!)
likes.disliked: — Rooms, food, service, price.... pretty much everything

reviews.text: The reception looks remotely grand, and check in was fairly smooth, even though they kicked up a fuss about paying by debit card??! There are fish tanks that run from the 1st floor up until the 4th (top) floor. This must have been very impressive when the hotel was first built, but the fish tanks just looked a little dirty for my liking.
reviews.title: An odd ball but good value & excellent for business/conference

reviews.text: My room... well it was just a room. Nothing special, medium sized and certainly not worth the price. The furniture was dated (think 80's mahogany chic with burgandy and forest green fabrics) and well worn, to put it nicely. In fact the paint/varnish was peeling away from the bathroom door. Complimentary toiletaries were rubbish- very cheap, more like what you would expect in a travelodge not anything you would expect in a 4* hotel. The TV had very bad reception, and the picture was very fuzzy. In addition the lock on the front door was very stiff and took me several minutes to lock and unlock. In fact I thought I was stuck in the room at one point, but luckily I managed to unlock it. A plus point, the room was clean. Tea/coffee facilities were avaliable, but the kettle took an age to boil.
reviews.title: Rubbish with a Capital R!

reviews.text: I rang down to ask reception to order a taxi... they did not pick up on two occasions, and on the third the receptionist just gave me a number, and did not offer to call the taxi for me.
reviews.title: Very poor breakfast - don't pay for it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was OK. Again I was quite looking forward to it, but it was plain. I've had better food and service at some 2* restaurants than this place. The waitresses took 5 minutes to seat me. Once they seated me, that was it. They were more interested in serving the grey haired businessmen rather than a young female!!!
reviews.title: Poor

description: The Coppid Beech Hotel is one of Berkshire’s finest four-star properties, providing guests with spacious, comfortable, modern bedrooms; excellent food and 2 distinctive bars. It also has dedicated and purpose built meeting and conference facilities; a live music venue and a fully equipped health club. The hotel has 205 bedrooms offering a variety of accommodation, including 19 suites, several family rooms and a selection of superior rooms.
